arts.sum: We hear from the players and manager after Scotland's victory over Liechtenstein.

arts.ttl: Watch highlights as Scotland ease past Liechtenstein
arts.sum: Highlights from Scotland's 4-0 win away to Liechtenstein.

arts.ttl: Scotland boss Steve Clarke happy as strikers seize chance against Liechtenstein
arts.sum: Clarke’s decision to start with a 4-4-2 formation paid off as Che Adams grabbed a hat-trick and George Hirst netted his first international goal.

arts.ttl: Hirst off mark and Adams ends drought in style as Scotland thrash Liechtenstein
arts.sum: George Hirst scored his first international goal and Che Adams grabbed a hat-trick as Scotland eased to a 4-0 victory against Liechtenstein. Ipswich striker Hirst got Scotland’s third goal in the Vaduz friendly early in the second half with a close-range finish on his fourth cap. Adams was on target twice in the first half after scoring only once in his previous 19 internationals and the Torino forward headed home with the last action of the game. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Steve Clarke insists angry Scotland took it out on Liechtenstein as he issues challenge to international new boys
arts.sum: The Scotland boss also hailed Lennon Miller and Ross Doohan as he says goodbye to assistant manager John Carver

arts.ttl: Adams nets hat trick as Scotland rout Liechtenstein
arts.sum: Ché Adams completed his hat trick in stoppage time as Scotland earned a 4-0 win over Liechtenstein in a friendly on Monday.

arts.ttl: George Hirst scores and Che Adams bags hat-trick as Scotland beat Liechtenstein
arts.sum: Ipswich striker Hirst netted his first Scotland goal on his third cap in the friendly in Vaduz.

arts.ttl: Che Adams ends Scotland drought in style as unrecognisable Steve Clarke side dismantles Liechtenstein - 5 talking points
arts.sum: Our man Scott Burns was in Liechtenstein as Clarke's much-changed side returned to winning ways

arts.ttl: Watch Adams put Scotland ahead away to Liechtenstein
arts.sum: Che Adams slots Scotland into an early lead in Liechtenstein.

arts.ttl: Liechtenstein vs Scotland LIVE as Ross Doohan and Lennon Miller handed starts in Vaduz
arts.sum: Steve Clarke's side need a morale boosting win in their final outing before the serious business of World Cup qualification
